DT_Translation_ApprovalFactors/approvalF: Not enough food variety on the marketplace
Not enough fuel on the marketplace
Not enough cloth variety on the marketplace
DT_Translation_BuildingDescriptions/buil: Provides living space for a single <h>FAMILY</>, or 2 families when expanded.
Workers fell nearby trees to produce TIMBER.
Space to grow various CROPS, including WHEAT, FLAX & BARLEY. {br}{br}To employ peasants on the fields, you need to build a FARMHOUSE.

Enables <h>TRADING</> with the visiting <h>TRAVELLING MERCHANTS</>, <h>TRADEPOINTS</> and Trading Posts in other Regions. {br}{br} <h>REGIONAL WEALTH</> is the currency used for trade. {br}{br} When employed, 1 family member travels to nearest possible destination to conduct trade, while other family members help manage the inventory. If needed, assigned families will automatically set up stalls on the marketplace to sell imported goods.
Used to extract IRON ORE from IRON DEPOSITS and CLAY from CLAY DEPOSITS.
Provides living space for a single <h>FAMILY</>, or 2 families when expanded.
Provides pasture space for livestock.

Provides space for the assigned families to set up their stalls and distribute their produce to the burgage plots.{br}{br}A healthy supply and demand ratio of goods is needed to fulfill RESIDENTIAL REQUIREMENTS and keep APPROVAL high.
Workers hunt WILD ANIMALS and produce MEAT and HIDES.
Workers transform TIMBER into PLANKS.
Converts GRAIN to FLOUR. {br}{br}Works most efficiently on empty land, unobstructed by buildings or trees.
Provides DRINKING WATER to the BURGAGE PLOTS. Enables FIREFIGHTING. {br}{br}Must be built over UNDERGROUND WATER.
Workers use IRON SLABS to craft TOOLS. Must be REFUELED once per month.
Workers use FLOUR to produce BREAD.
Workers use HIDES to produce LEATHER.
Provides 1 <h>STABLE SPACE</>. Assigned families become permanent <h>OX GUIDES</>, which speeds ups logistics.
Workers collect WOOL from grazing SHEEP {br}{br}Sheep must first be imported via the LIVESTOCK TRADER.
Charcoal kilns convert 1 FIREWOOD into 2 CHARCOAL, making refueling twice as efficient.
Workers use WOOL to produce YARN, and FLAX to produce LINEN.
Fulfils 1 level of FAITH requirement for the BURGAGE PLOTS.{br}{br} Provides HALLOWED GROUND for BURIAL of the dead villagers. Workers become GRAVEDIGGERS.
Workers gather BERRIES from nearby BERRY DEPOSITS.
Fulfills 1 level of the ENTERTAINMENT requirement for the BURGAGE PLOTS. Like many of your citizens, it needs ALE to function.
Workers use MALT to produce ALE.
Workers gather STONE from nearby FIELDSTONE DEPOSITS.
Workers convert IRON ORE into IRON SLABS. Needs to be REFUELED once per month.
Use this tool to layout the CASTLE WALLS. {br}{br} GATES are created automatically when a wall is placed over a road. Every gate adds 1 TIMBER to the construction cost.
Workers collect HONEY. Every region can sustain up to 2 apiaries by default, placing more will not increase the yields.
Used to extract IRON ORE from IRON DEPOSITS and CLAY from CLAY DEPOSITS. {br}{br} If placed over a RICH DEPOSIT, the mine has output even after the surface deposit runs out.
Increases maximum <h>RETINUE SIZE</> by 12. Limited by 1 per Region.
Cosmetic only - under rework.
Provides living space for 2 families, or up to 4 families when expanded.
Workers use BARLEY to produce MALT. Needs to be REFUELED once per month.

Workers collect, store, and distribute goods using GENERIC STORAGE. {br}{br}If needed, they will also automatically set up stalls on the marketplace to distribute the stored goods to the BURGAGE PLOTS.

Used to employ families on the FIELD. {br}Farm workers plow the fields as soon as the Winter passes, but no later than November. Then, they sow them with the chosen crop. Harvest happens around September. {br}{br}Then the crops are transported to the Farmhouse, and WHEAT is threshed into GRAIN.

Workers collect, store, and distribute goods using GENERIC STORAGE. {br}{br}If needed, they will also automatically set up stalls on the marketplace to distribute the stored goods to the BURGAGE PLOTS.

Fulfills 2 levels of FAITH requirement for the BURGAGE PLOTS. {br}{br}Grants 250 INFLUENCE when completed. {br}{br} Provides HALLOWED GROUND for BURIAL of the dead villagers. Workers become GRAVEDIGGERS.
Enables trading LIVESTOCK with Tradepoints and other settled regions.
Workers collect, store, and distribute goods using the PANTRY. {br}{br}If needed, they will also automatically set up stalls on the marketplace to distribute the stored goods to the BURGAGE PLOTS.
Cosmetic only, at least for now.
Workers plant new trees in the specified zones.
Temporary living space for the homeless. {br}{br}After all homeless find accomodation, the tents disappear automatically.
A temporary dump of supplies. May be vulnerable to <h>WEATHER DAMAGE</>.
Workers fell nearby trees to produce FIREWOOD.
Distributes a variety of food to fulfill residential requirements.
Distributes all types of fuel to fulfill residential requirements.
Distributes various types of cloth to fulfill residential requirements.

Residence of you and your retinue. {br}{br}Grants 250 INFLUENCE and rises the ADMINISTRATION LEVEL by 1. {br}{br}After building your very first Manor, the starting retinue will join you in your palace for free.
A permanent market stall, which provides a passive income of FIREWOOD, as long as the region has enough REGIONAL WEALTH. Region does not pay the TRANSPORT FEE. Must be placed on the MARKETPLACE.
A permanent market stall, which provides a passive income of BREAD, as long as the region has enough REGIONAL WEALTH. Region does not pay the TRANSPORT FEE. Must be placed on the MARKETPLACE.
Place it on the empty claimed territory in order to settle it. Grants base starting supplies and 5 starting families.
Converts CLAY to CLAY TILES. Needs to be refueled once per month.
Clear an area from non-gameplay related shrubs and small stones.

Provides crude living space for 5 families. Contrary to Burgage Plots, can't be upgraded or expanded and may cause a small loss of <h>APPROVAL</>. {br}{br} Best suited as worker accomodation for <h>OUTPOSTS</>.

Use this building to setup a <h>BARTER CONNECTION</>, allowing you to send and receive goods between this and another <h>REGION</> in your command. {br}{br} Employ <h>MULES</> to transport up to 20 goods per trip.
Not all deserve to be buried on consecrated ground. Use this building to get rid of any raider corpses quickly. Workers become <h>GRAVEDIGGERS</>.
Provides 10 GARRISON SPACE. Garrisoned units and villagers shoot projectiles at approaching enemies.
Workers convert BERRIES into DYES.
DT_Translation_DevelopmentBranches/devID: Sheep grazing on the pastures slowly multiply.
Doubles the amount of meat harvested by hunters.
Enables the beekeepers to also collect WAX.
Dramatically lowers the amount of damage caused by <h>DROUGHTS</>.
Unlocks <h>RYE</> crop for <h>FIELDS</>. Similar to <h>WHEAT</>, <h>RYE</> can be processed into <h>FLOUR</>, but it's more resilient and therefore can be grown in places with lower fertility.
Enables hunters to skillfully lay traps in the forest, which give a passive income of MEAT.
Hunters will also extract HIDES from wild animals.
Reduces the foreign import tariff by half, which makes trading with Free Merchants far more profitable.
Hunters also collect HIDES from traps.
Enables blacksmiths to craft MAIL ARMOR, which can be used to equip citizens of Burgage Plots of LEVEL 3 and above, or promoting new RETINUE.
Enables blacksmiths to craft PLATE ARMOR, which can in turn be used to upgrade the RETINUE.
Establishing a new <h>TRADE ROUTE</> costs 50% less.
Locked in early access. Work in progress.
DT_Translation_Diplomacy/antagonism: I hope your fiefdom rots to hell, and soon.
DT_Translation_Diplomacy/claim_press: I declare myself the true liege of...
DT_Translation_Diplomacy/competitive: This letter is a warning and a challenge. I will not rest until I see you defeated and dethroned.
DT_Translation_Diplomacy/competitive_01: I will be the one to bring justice and order to these lands and to restore their rightful owners.
DT_Translation_Diplomacy/competitive_02: Prepare yourself for war, for I am coming for you.
DT_Translation_Diplomacy/insult: Your mother was a hamster, and your father smelt of elderberries.
DT_Translation_Diplomacy/insult_2: You are a bastard and a fraud, and your bloodline is tainted and cursed.
DT_Translation_Diplomacy/insult_3: You are a tyrant and a coward, and you have no vision or honor.
DT_Translation_Diplomacy/need_silver: I require silver for my endavours.
DT_Translation_Diplomacy/peace_offer: Let there be peace and prosperity between us.
DT_Translation_Diplomacy/peace_offer_acc: I accept. Let there be peace between our fiefdoms.
DT_Translation_Diplomacy/peace_offer_rej: I apologise, but I do not feel like a peace treaty would benefit my cause.
DT_Translation_Diplomacy/peace_silver: We can end this squabble - for a small payment.
DT_Translation_Diplomacy/peace_silver_of: I can make it worthwhile if you drop all your claims.
I may withdraw my claims for such a price.
Accept the offer to withdraw claims in exchange for payment.
Decline offer to withdraw claims in exchange for payment.
DT_Translation_Diplomacy/signature_defau: Signed and sealed by my own seal,
DT_Translation_Diplomacy/welcome_from_hi: I have heard of your renown. I only seek to defend my rights and my honour against those who would wrong me. {br}{br}I hope you will not judge me by the rumours and slanders that some may spread about me.
DT_Translation_Diplomacy/welcome_hildebo: I write to you with disdain and suspicion, for I have heard much about you and your crimes.
You have seized power and wealth, despite the laws that forbade you.
You have shown yourself to be an unworthy occupant of these lands, and a bastard of lowly origin.
I am concerned about you and your actions, for I fear that you will bring more trouble and violence to these regions, which have been ravaged by war and chaos.
You have my contempt and distrust, and I hope to inspire yours.
Greetings, Hildebolt von Bereneute, the rightful lord of Selbitz and Hofstetten.
I write to you with admiration and curiosity, for I have heard much about you and your deeds.
You have risen to power and glory, despite the obstacles and enemies that stood in your way.
You have my admiration and curiosity, and I hope to earn yours.
I am interested in knowing more about you and your plans, for I share your desire to bring peace and stability to these regions, which have been plagued by war and turmoil.
I believe that we can work together for the common good, and that we can achieve great things.
DT_Translation_Diplomacy/welcome_negativ: Ah, yet another dog has crawled here.
DT_Translation_Diplomacy/welcome_positiv: It's a pleasure to meet you.
DT_Translation_Diplomacy/welcome_respons: Nice to meet you too, you filthy bastard.
I'm sorry, have I wronged you somehow?
Who the hell are you, sausage breath?
I hope our fiefdoms grow in prosperity together.
Thank you for your hearty welcome.
You have no rightful claim to Selbitz and Hofstetten.
You have proven yourself to be a true leader of Selbitz and Hofstetten.
I have no doubt that you are the rightful heir of these lands, and that your bloodline is pure and noble.
DT_Translation_Events_Common/bandit_camp: These men are heedless of both sacred and secular laws and will become a nuissance to your people. {br}{br}However, if we were to form a military expedition, who knows what valuables they hide in their encampment?
DT_Translation_Events_Common/i_will_unit: I'll unite these lands under my rule.
DT_Translation_Events_Common/keep_spoils: This belongs to my Treasury now
DT_Translation_Events_Common/raiders_nea: We've received reports of a band of raiders roaming the nearby lands. Should we track their steps?
DT_Translation_Events_Common/return_reso: Send resources to the nearest town
DT_Translation_Events_Common/spoils_of_w: When searching through the enemy belongings, you find a stash of goods. They could be send to your people who surely need them, though, it is your right to keep it.
DT_Translation_Events_Common/victory_con: You were born for great things and if God wills it, great things you will achieve. {br}{br}Build up your <h>INFLUENCE</> and press <h>CLAIMS</> to all the territories on the map. Once claimed, victory will be yours.
DT_Translation_Events_Common/victory_dom: Build up your town, your manor, and when ready - press claims towards regions owned by your opponents. {br}{br}Once a claim has been pressed, be ready for battle.
DT_Translation_Events_Common/victory_gro: Where others see trouble, you see potential. These lands shall become rich and prosperous under your skillful management. {br}{br}Reach the <h>LARGE TOWN</> settlement level to achieve victory.
DT_Translation_Events_Introduction/lv2_q: As you walk the perimeter, surveying your village with pride, a woman walks past you, her back bent nearly double under a sturdy wattle basket. {br}{br}You ask how long she's been walking, and she tells you it's half a day now to get all the food she needs for her family from the huts surrounding the village. {br}{br}If only there was a marketplace where your people could acquire food, clothing, and firewood, they would be happier and have more time for other matters.
DT_Translation_Events_Introduction/manor: Good craftsmanship marries form and function. It is solid and reliable, but it dreams of perfection, just like good leadership. {br}{br}Perhaps that is why you've insisted that your servants bring your favorite chair with you. Covered in exquisite carvings of unicorns and griffons, the well-worn arms feel secure. But the chair is heavy, and it looks out of place in your temporary quarters, lavish as they may be. It deserves a place of honor in a great hall. {br}{br}You have provided homes and comforts for your people. Now it's time to plan your own residence.
DT_Translation_Events_Introduction/resid: Your supplies are dry and secure, and the first stage of work is done. {br}{br}The stories your people tell around the fire are of the many dangers in the world, from beasts to blights. Soon, they'll teach these stories to their own children. {br}{br}It's time to bring more people to the settlement, now that they can take shelter in proper homes. {br}{br}For your lands to prosper and grow, you'll need not only workers, but families.
DT_Translation_Events_Introduction/royal: To the region of {homeRegion}, you are hereby on omission of debt for the lands on which the royal crown has granted stewardship to the honorable {playerName}.  A tax is to be levied upon the land to be paid in precious wealth or labor.  Failure to submit payment will find the lands forfeit the governance under the stewards and returned to the crown.
DT_Translation_Events_Introduction/settl: There is a fire at the heart of every settlement: a bastion of safety and light against the darkness of the world.{br}{br}As you watch the flames of the camp's fireplace dwindle in the early morning mist, you can almost hear the ring of anvils, the tolling of bells, the cries of the marketplace. Possibilities.
DT_Translation_Events_RestoringThePeace/: I vow to restore peace and prosperity to this land.

By the grace of His Royal Highness, the prince of this realm, you have been chosen to govern a land of great peril and promise. {br}{br}It has suffered long from the scourge of banditry, but there is another threat that looms over this land: an illegitimate baron who claims the northern territories as his own. {br}{br}Will you prove yourself worthy of this honor, or will you perish by the traitorâ€™s steel?

A strong militia is paramount to the survival of any settlement. Luckily, a shipment of weapons has just arrived, and you will now be able to create your first militia banners to serve you and protect your people. {br}{br}However, we will need more weapons to equip all the people as the settlement grows, either by making them or importing them from other lands.
DT_Translation_GameSetups/baron_setup: Two territories in the north are claimed by the illegitimate Baron whose castle is located off the map. Bandit camps reside in the other, unclaimed regions. {br}{br}Build and expand at your own pace. When ready, challenge the Baron for the northern territories.
DT_Translation_GameSetups/peaceful_cityb: Reach the "Large town" settlement level. After that, you may choose to continue in the endless mode.
Fulfill the requirements of your citizens, plan and rule your medieval town as you see fit, without worrying about combat.
DT_Translation_GameSetups/survival_goal: Survive all the attacks and reach the "Large town" settlement level.
DT_Translation_GameSetups/survival_setup: Grow your city and raise forces as quickly as you can. The lands are pestered by raiders and undefended settlements will quickly perish.
DT_Translation_in_progress/barter_warnin: Both Regions must offer something for barter to work
DT_Translation_in_progress/load_custom_c: Go to Drive/Users/Username/AppData/Local/ManorLords/Saved/SaveGames/ and place your square custom_coat.png file to import your custom graphic for the coat of arms and the banner.
DT_Translation_in_progress/market_supply: This view doesn't show physical locations of goods, but instead it shows their <h>AVAILABILITY</>. Burgage plots nearest to the Marketplace have the best availability of goods, and therefore can be upgraded faster. It creates a cascading effect, and houses on the outskirts will always have a worse time upgrading.
DT_Translation_LogEntries/band_of_raider: A band of raiders was seen near
DT_Translation_LogEntries/cant_find_spac: Can't find a Storehouse for excess weapon storage
DT_Translation_LogEntries/drought: The lands are stricken by a drought!
DT_Translation_LogEntries/drought_crops_: Crop yields were damaged by drought!
DT_Translation_LogEntries/family_joins: Family members join one of the settlers.
DT_Translation_LogEntries/family_left_to: A family has left the town
DT_Translation_LogEntries/family_turned_: A family has turned to banditry!
DT_Translation_LogEntries/field_unplowed: A field wasn't fully plowed before the winter
DT_Translation_LogEntries/field_unsowed_: A field wasn't fully sown before the winter
DT_Translation_LogEntries/goods_stolen: Resource stolen by the nearby bandits
DT_Translation_LogEntries/missing_stall_: Family requests more market area for their stall.
DT_Translation_LogEntries/mule_required_: A mule is required for high value barter
DT_Translation_LogEntries/new_family: A new family started moving in.
DT_Translation_LogEntries/no_appropriate: No valid storage for barter in this Region
DT_Translation_LogEntries/no_builders: Unassigned families needed for construction work!
DT_Translation_LogEntries/no_free_ox_gui: No unassigned families to guide the ox.
DT_Translation_LogEntries/no_free_oxen: Unassigned Oxen are needed for construction
DT_Translation_LogEntries/no_room_to_pro: No storage space left for production
Production halted because storage is full
DT_Translation_LogEntries/not_enough_mon: Not enough Treasury for the Annual Royal Tax!
DT_Translation_LogEntries/tithe_paid_goo: Tithe paid, goods given away
DT_Translation_MainUI/allow_foreign_trad: By turning this setting off you tell your workers to only trade between the Regions on the map and ignore <h>TRADEPOINTS</> and <h>FREE MERCHANTS</> .
DT_Translation_MainUI/allow_idle_descr: Allow citizens to use this building as a temporary job when they're idle.
DT_Translation_MainUI/allow_stalls_descr: Use this setting to restrict <h>ASSIGNED FAMILIES</>, or families living here and producing goods in <h>EXTENSIONS</> from automatically setting up <h>MARKET STALLS</>.
DT_Translation_MainUI/approval_descr: Controls overall <h>POPULATION GROWTH</> as well as <h>MORALE</> of <h>MILITIA</> rallied from this settlement.
DT_Translation_MainUI/approval_will_fall: Approval will fall if not fulfilled
DT_Translation_MainUI/assigned_descr: These families will <h>FOCUS ON THE JOB</> they were assigned to.
DT_Translation_MainUI/barter_value_descr: When moving things between Regions, the exchange value of goods needs to match.{br} For instance, if you exchange Iron at, let's say, 14 silver per unit for Firewood at 7 silver per unit, {br}the barter value is 2x (you get 2 Firewood for every Iron)
DT_Translation_MainUI/build_extension_de: Extensions can provide <h>ADDITIONAL RESOURCE YIELDS</> at the cost of peasants taking time to work on them instead of their assigned jobs.
DT_Translation_MainUI/building_pause_des: Temporarily halts all construction and work related tasks.
DT_Translation_MainUI/cant_claim_when_en: Can't claim when enemy units are present
DT_Translation_MainUI/census_descr: Lists in detail all the inhabitants and livestock of this region
DT_Translation_MainUI/challenge_proposeB: Propose to change the battlefield (Locked in early access)
DT_Translation_MainUI/challenge_useKings: Use King's Favor (Locked in early access)
DT_Translation_MainUI/company_cost_toolt: TREASURY cost, paid upfront for each month of service.
DT_Translation_MainUI/construction_prior: Buildings with the highest priority number are built first.
DT_Translation_MainUI/demolish_descr: Press to demolish this building. Construction resources will be refunded.
DT_Translation_MainUI/desired_surplus_ch: Desired surplus. {br}(Locked because the Trade Rule is set to "No trade").
DT_Translation_MainUI/desired_surplus_no: A TRADE ROUTE is required first.
DT_Translation_MainUI/dev_tree_desc: Each level gets you a Development Point that you can use to specialize your town and make it more efficient.
DT_Translation_MainUI/development_missin: Development branches missing in this Region
DT_Translation_MainUI/dimidiation_descr: An older form of Marshalling (combining two Coats of Arms into one) by cutting them in the middle. {br}{br}Half dog, half horse? Why not!
DT_Translation_MainUI/foreign_market_sup: Global market supply: Undersupplied. Prices are higher than usual.
Global market supply: Oversupplied. Prices are lower than usual.
Global market supply: Critically undersupplied. Prices are much higher than usual.
Global market supply: Critically oversupplied. {br}Extremely low prices, <r>no foreign exports!</>
DT_Translation_MainUI/fuel_reserves_desc: How many months of Fuel supply to keep in storage.
DT_Translation_MainUI/hire_company_confi: This company is ready to serve you, as long as you have the coin
DT_Translation_MainUI/influence_descr: Required for diplomacy and pressing <h>CLAIMS</>. {br}{br}Can be gained from the Tithe, conquering Brigands and upgrading your Churches and Manors.
DT_Translation_MainUI/kings_favour_descr: Can be used for diplomatic purposes, including pressing and refuting claims.
DT_Translation_MainUI/living_space_descr: How many <h>FAMILIES</> this Region can currently accomodate. To increase it, build or expand your <h>BURGAGE PLOTS</>.
DT_Translation_MainUI/mourning_period_de: This household has suffered a recent loss and will not grow until the mourning has ended.
DT_Translation_MainUI/no_companies_avail: No more mercenary companies available this month
DT_Translation_MainUI/order_descr: Governs the chance of crime occuring, as well as citizens permanently turning to banditry.
DT_Translation_MainUI/overlaps_habitat: Overlaps animal habitat - will cause migration!
DT_Translation_MainUI/pin_building_panel: Disconnects this panel from the building.
DT_Translation_MainUI/press_to_open_dev_: Press to open the Development View
DT_Translation_MainUI/reassignFamilyButt: Reassign family to a different workplace
DT_Translation_MainUI/recruit_men_at_arm: Pay from your TREASURY to hire a retainer who already owns basic military equipment.
DT_Translation_MainUI/regional_wealth_de: Amount of money owned by villagers from this <h>REGION</>. Can be used for <h>IMPORT</> or converted to <h>TREASURY</> via a <h>TAX</> <h>POLICY</>.
DT_Translation_MainUI/relocate_battlefie: Ask to relocate the battlefield (locked in early access)
DT_Translation_MainUI/relocate_descr: Press to change the building's location for free.
DT_Translation_MainUI/resourceGroup_comm: <i>Requested by the burgage plots, depending on their level and employment. </>
DT_Translation_MainUI/resourceGroup_cons: <i>Used to construct new buildings and upgrade them.</>
DT_Translation_MainUI/resourceGroup_food: <i>Used to fill Hunger. Greater variety boosts disease resistance.</>
DT_Translation_MainUI/resourceGroup_fuel: <i>Consumed by Burgage Plots and various workplaces. </>
DT_Translation_MainUI/resourceGroup_mili: <i>For upgrading the militia and your retinue.</>
DT_Translation_MainUI/royal_tax_descr: Enact tax policies to increase Treasury.
DT_Translation_MainUI/show_surplus_off_d: All stored goods present in the region.{br}{br}Imagine you have 5 planks, and place a building that costs 5 planks to build. Your stock remains 5, but surplus becomes 0 since resources get reserved for construction.
DT_Translation_MainUI/show_surplus_on_de: Surplus shows stock minus reserved number of goods. It can go negative if for example your recruits are missing equipment.{br}{br}Imagine you have 5 planks, and place a building that costs 5 planks to build. Your stock remains 5, but surplus becomes 0 since resources get reserved for construction.
DT_Translation_MainUI/stat_armor_descr: Reduces damage caused by <h>ATTACK</> and <h>RANGED ATTACK</>. Increases <h>FATIGUE</> rate.
DT_Translation_MainUI/stat_attack_descr: Base melee attack power. Modified by <h>EFFECTIVENESS</>, <h>BACKSTABBING</> and <h>ARMOR</>, <h>BLOCK</> of the enemy.
DT_Translation_MainUI/stat_impaling_desc: When immobile and facing the enemy, absorbs enemies <h>CHARGE</> and turns it against them.
DT_Translation_MainUI/stat_missile_range: How far can the soldiers shoot. Chance to miss is very high at maximum range and gets lower the closer the target is, peaking at distance being equal to 25% of the maximum range and closer.
DT_Translation_MainUI/stat_missileBlock_: Reduces damage caused by <h>ATTACK</> and <h>RANGED ATTACK</> but only if directly facing the enemy with the shield. Increases <h>FATIGUE</> rate.
DT_Translation_MainUI/stat_ranged_attack: Base missile attack power. Modified by distance to  the enemy, <h>EFFECTIVENESS</>, <h>BACKSTABBING</> and <h>ARMOR</>, <h>BLOCK</> of the enemy.
DT_Translation_MainUI/supplies: Number of months before supplies run out
DT_Translation_MainUI/supplies_descr: Every Burgage Plot consumes 1 FOOD and 1 per month. FUEL consumption in the WINTER is doubled. Additionally, some workplaces consume 1 FUEL per month as well.
DT_Translation_MainUI/tax_citizen_descr: Collected from REGIONAL WEALTH, calculated only per BURGAGE PLOT of level 3 and above.
DT_Translation_MainUI/tax_merc_descr: Amount raised from REGIONAL WEALTH to cover hiring of MERCENARY COMPANIES . Won't cause loss of APPROVAL as long as mercenaries are actually employed.
DT_Translation_MainUI/tax_mill_descr: Collected from REGIONAL WEALTH every time the mill grounds 100 GRAIN into FLOUR.
DT_Translation_MainUI/tax_tithe_descr: Percentage of surplus FOOD that is given to the CHURCH in return for INFLUENCE.
DT_Translation_MainUI/tax_trade_descr: Collected from REGIONAL WEALTH for every transaction with a visiting TRAVELLING MERCHANT.
DT_Translation_MainUI/tax_war_descr: Collected from REGIONAL WEALTH if the player is in an official state of WAR.
DT_Translation_MainUI/this_good_requires: Since it's a MAJOR TRADE, a TRADE ROUTE is required first.
DT_Translation_MainUI/tip_challenge: Bring your army to the battlefield area to win the Challenge. The battlefield may shift after the battle is initiated. {br}Skirmishes too far from the battle area don't count towards the Claim.
DT_Translation_MainUI/tip_crop_yield: Estimated resources produced (days left to harvest)
DT_Translation_MainUI/tip_field_priority: Fields with the highest priority are taken care of first.
DT_Translation_MainUI/tip_force_early_ha: Ignore harvesting season and harvest immediately. Minimum crop growth for any kind of harvest is 15%.
DT_Translation_MainUI/tooltip_challenge_: Both challengers must bring their armies to the <h>BATTLEFIELD</>. When the time runs out and there is no chalanger's troops present on the battlefield, the Lord who initiated the challenge wins.
DT_Translation_MainUI/tooltip_marketStal: This family owns a market stall. If you unassign them, {br}the market will have to be taken over by someone else.
DT_Translation_MainUI/tradingGoods_advan: An established TRADE ROUTE is required to trade these types of goods with the FREE MERCHANTS.
DT_Translation_MainUI/tradingGoods_basic: FREE MERCHANTS trade these goods without limits. You can also buy/sell these goods via TRADEPOINTS.
DT_Translation_MainUI/treasury_descr: Your personal money, usually collected from <h>TAXES</>. Can be used for <h>DIPLOMACY</>, hiring <h>RETINUE</> and <h>MERCENARIES</>, as well as <h>SETTLING</> a new Region. Build a Manor to enable taxation in any controlled Region.
DT_Translation_MainUI/unassigned_descr: Families without assignment will work on CONSTRUCTION, including guiding the ox to transport TIMBER.
DT_Translation_MainUI/use_kings_favor: Use kings favor (locked in early access)
DT_Translation_MainUI/visit_mode_descr: <r>VERY EARLY IN DEVELOPMENT, EXPECT GLITCHES.</> {br}{br}Press to walk around your town in third-person mode.
DT_Translation_Menus/allow_squad_assignm: Allow assignment to multiple control groups
DT_Translation_Menus/approval_will_fall_: Approval will fall if not fulfilled
DT_Translation_Menus/build_extension_des: Extensions add extra production functionality to the residential buildings.
DT_Translation_Menus/coat_of_arms_load_b: Press to load. Note: You will not be able to further edit it after loading (Work in progress).
DT_Translation_Menus/coat_of_arms_load_c: Go to C:/Users/AppData/ManorLords/Saved/SavedGames and place a custom_coat.png file to have your own custom symbol in the game.
DT_Translation_Menus/coat_of_arms_save_b: Press to save. Note: You will not be able to edit it further it's loaded again (Work in progress).
DT_Translation_Menus/coming_soon: More coming soon -AI citybuilding is still under rework
DT_Translation_Menus/cropID_0_descr: Fallow fields regenerate all types of <h>FERTILITY</>, but have no yields.
DT_Translation_Menus/cropID_1_descr: WHEAT is threshed into GRAIN at the FARM. {br}After that it can be processed further into FLOUR and BREAD.
DT_Translation_Menus/cropID_2_descr: FLAX can be weaved into LINEN.
DT_Translation_Menus/cropID_3_descr: Barley can be processed into MALT and then into ALE.
DT_Translation_Menus/cropID_7_descr: Similar to wheat, can be processed into GRAIN. {br}However, it's more resilient and therefore can be grown in more areas.
DT_Translation_Menus/cropRotation_descr: Brings back the lost <h>FERTILITY</>. {br}Crop rotation triggers after the Harvest Season ends. {br}Keeping the field Fallow regenerates the most Fertility.
DT_Translation_Menus/early_access_msg: This game is still in development
DT_Translation_Menus/early_access_msg_de: Manor Lords is an indie passion project and even though it's been 7 years, the game still needs more time to be fully complete. {br}{br}Certain game or platform features aren't available yet, and you will probably encounter bugs. Feel free to drop feedback on our Discord channel where I try to respond every day. {br}{br}Thank you for understanding as I continue work on the game,{br}{br}Greg, Manor Lords dev

Manor Lords is an indie passion project, currently a Game Preview title, and even though it's been 7 years, the game still needs more time to be fully complete.{br}{br}Certain game or platform features might not work as expected, and you will probably encounter bugs or crashes. {br}{br}Feel free to drop feedback on our Discord server, and for support please contact support@hoodedhorse.com{br}{br}Thank you for understanding as I continue work on the game,{br}Greg, Manor Lords dev
DT_Translation_Menus/establish_trade_rou: Pay to establish a Trade Route?
DT_Translation_Menus/gameSetting_aggress: AI Lords don't press Claims towards the player's Regions, but they will protect their own.
AI Lords may press a Claim towards the player's Regions after they run out of neutral Regions to claim.
AI Lords may press Claims towards the player Regions at will.
DT_Translation_Menus/gameSetting_approva: Approval factors have a low impact on population growth.
Approval factors have an average impact on population growth.
Approval factors have a significant impact on population growth.
DT_Translation_Menus/gameSetting_armamen: A free weapon delivery for militia as soon as the player builds a Storehouse and 5 Residential Plots.
DT_Translation_Menus/gameSetting_banditC: No random Bandit Camps spawning during play.
Random Bandit Camps stop spawning if there are already 3 of them.
Random Bandit Camps stop spawning if there are already 5 of them.
DT_Translation_Menus/gameSetting_baron_1: Adds an AI opponent located off map. He controls 2 Regions and  brings his soldiers to the main game map when challenged.
DT_Translation_Menus/gameSetting_initial: No Bandit Camps present when the game begins.
One Bandit Camp present when the game begins.
Two Bandit Camps present when the game begins.
Three Bandit Camps present when the game begins.
Four Bandit Camps present when the game begins.
Five Bandit Camps present when the game begins.
DT_Translation_Menus/gameSetting_kingsTa: Royal taxes are collected annually from each Region with a Settlement Level of "Small Village" and above. The rate is 1 TREASURY per resident per Settlement Level.
Royal taxes are collected annually from each Region with a Settlement Level of "Small Village" and above. The rate is 2 TREASURY per resident per Settlement Level.
DT_Translation_Menus/gameSetting_raiderF: Raids start to happen after a year.
Two years before raids start happening.
Three years before raids start happening.
DT_Translation_Menus/gameSetting_raiders: No more than a single raid every 2 years.
Possibly less than a year between each raid.
DT_Translation_Menus/gameSetting_require: Town will not grow if requirements are unfilled.
Requirements triggering loss of Approval are shifted by 1 level to be less demanding.
Requirements triggering loss of Approval are shifted by 1 level to be more demanding.
DT_Translation_Menus/gameSetting_resourc: Starting Regions get 2 guaranteed Food Deposits, 1 small Iron Deposit, 1 small Stone Deposit and 1 random bonus Deposit. Other Regions get 3 random Deposits.
Every Region starts with 4 random Deposits. Advanced setting - early trade might be required if no Food is present!
Every Region starts with from 0 to 4 Random Deposits. This can be unfair and is for advanced players only.
Starting Regions get 2 nearby Food Deposits, 1 far Food Deposit,  1 Iron, 1 Clay and 1 Stone Deposit. Other Regions get 3 random Deposits.
DT_Translation_Menus/gameSetting_startin: A balanced start with available Seasonal Deposits, room to start farming early, but frequent rains.
More difficult start with no time to start farming and average Seasonal Deposits, but less requent rains.
Challenging start with approaching winter, dwindling Seasonal Deposits and frequent rains.
A challenging start with no Seasonal Deposits, risk of Freezing and decaying supplies due to snowfall.
A random day of the year.
DT_Translation_Menus/gameSetting_supplie: A balanced amount of starting supplies.
More starting supplies for a more relaxed experience.
DT_Translation_Menus/gameSetting_victory: Reach Large Town settlement level to win.
Eliminate all the other Lords by claiming their territory.
DT_Translation_Menus/gameSetting_weather: Weather is cosmetic only and won't do any harm.

Players get a warning if supplies get soaked, and when the next rain comes, they may get destroyed. A chance of random Droughts in the summers which may kill crops. Rare fires caused by thunderstrikes.
Droughts may happen in the summers, thunderstrikes cause fires and rain instantly damages exposed supplies.
DT_Translation_Menus/gameSetting_well_0_: Players may place wells everywhere without constraints.
DT_Translation_Menus/gameSetting_well_1_: Players may only place wells on top of Underground Water.
DT_Translation_Menus/pasture_space_descr: Space for your sheep and lambs to graze. Without enough space the animals may run away.
DT_Translation_Menus/recruit_men_at_arms: Offer payment for whoever may seek to enter your service, from lower nobles to distant relatives.
DT_Translation_Menus/recruit_ministerial: Promote one of your citizens to your retinue (locked in early access).
DT_Translation_Menus/requirement0_tier0: Any well constructed in the region
DT_Translation_Menus/requirement1_tier0: At least 1 TYPE of FOOD supplied on the MARKETPLACE
DT_Translation_Menus/requirement1_tier1: At least 2 TYPES of FOOD supplied on the MARKETPLACE
DT_Translation_Menus/requirement1_tier2: At least 3 TYPES of FOOD supplied on the MARKETPLACE
DT_Translation_Menus/requirement1_tier3: At least 4 TYPES of FOOD supplied on the MARKETPLACE
DT_Translation_Menus/requirement1_tier4: At least 5 TYPES of FOOD supplied on the MARKETPLACE
DT_Translation_Menus/requirement2_tier0: Enough fuel on the marketplace stalls
DT_Translation_Menus/requirement3_tier0: Enough supply of any of the following materials on the MARKETPLACE: {br} LINEN, LEATHER, YARN.
DT_Translation_Menus/requirement3_tier1: Enough supply of any of the following materials on the MARKETPLACE: {br} SHOES, CLOTHES, CLOAKS
DT_Translation_Menus/requirement4_tier0: Any kind of TAVERN building in the region with a steady supply of ALE.
DT_Translation_Menus/requirement5_tier1: At least a small stone church
DT_Translation_Menus/retinue_numbers_des: You can increase your maximum retinue size by expanding your manor.
DT_Translation_Menus/scenario_baron_desc: Reclaim the lands in the North from the illegitimate lord and clear all regions of banditry.
DT_Translation_Menus/scenario_battle_ban: You've raised a small force, intending to put an end to the local bandit lord and his troops. Unfortunately, they knew you were coming.
DT_Translation_Menus/scenario_battle_fie: You've waited a long time to see your rival face-to-face. Now you get a chance to finally put him and his army in their place.
DT_Translation_Menus/scenario_conquest_d: Due to a tangled  history, there are multiple claimants to these disputed lands. Use economy, diplomacy, and warfare to your advantage to become the sole ruler.
DT_Translation_Menus/scenario_sandbox_de: You are the first lord to settle these lands. Start from nothing and build a prosperous medieval city.
DT_Translation_Menus/settings_mouse_lock: Lock cursor inside the game window
DT_Translation_Menus/stable_space_descr: Space for your hardworking oxen and horses. Animals may run away if not enough space is provided.
DT_Translation_Menus/storage_accept_all_: Accept all goods from this category
DT_Translation_Menus/storage_reject_all_: Reject all goods from this category
DT_Translation_Menus/tip_refueling_descr: Work buildings need 1 unit of FUEL per month to function, while residential building fuel consumption varies from 1 per month during warm seasons to 2 per month during the winter.
DT_Translation_Menus/tooltip_log_reserve: Reserve will never be used for crafting, so that {br}enough raw resources are left for construction.
DT_Translation_Menus/tooltip_outpost_mot: The new outpost will become an extension of this town and you will be able to assign families from the town to work here without having to build <h>BURGAGE PLOTS</> to accomodate them. They will also consume resources like <h>FOOD</> and <h>FIREWOOD</> from their home in this town.
DT_Translation_Menus/trade_route_establi: After paying to establish a <h>TRADE ROUTE</>, a dedicated <h>FREE MERCHANT</> will regularly visit your <h>REGION</> to <h>TRADE</> only this specific type of good.
DT_Translation_Menus/tradeRule_0_descr: Trade Rule: Never trade this good
DT_Translation_Menus/tradeRule_1_descr: Trade Rule: Buy until the Desired Surplus is reached.
DT_Translation_Menus/tradeRule_2_descr: Trade Rule: Sell until the Desired Surplus is reached.
DT_Translation_Menus/tradeRule_3_descr: Trade Rule: Trade until Desired Surplus is reached.
DT_Translation_Menus/upgrade_armor_impor: Pay the full price to import the armor set for this retainer.
DT_Translation_Menus/upgrade_armor_local: Pay half price buying from the local armorers. The treasury funds will get transfered to the regional wealth.
DT_Translation_MercenaryCompanies/battle: Story tells they all lost a bet with their former liege in a brothel, leading them to abandoning their former lives and joining him as fighters. They decided to stick to this life.
DT_Translation_MercenaryCompanies/brigan: A large pack of baddies, lead by the biggest and the toughest of them all.
A small pack of local misfits and troublemakers.
DT_Translation_MercenaryCompanies/brothe: Those men seem to pride themselves on stealing from the rich and giving to the poor. They also seem to wear extremely tight hosen.
DT_Translation_MercenaryCompanies/crazy_: The origin of the goose is vague. A lot of members used to be broke farmers. Practically anyone can join this company as long as they do not fear death.
DT_Translation_MercenaryCompanies/greenc: A reformed band of outlaws, sporting fashionable green hats for which they are known.
DT_Translation_MercenaryCompanies/vultur: Well disciplined fighters. For an unknown reason they discarded the sword and only use maces and axes as weapons of choice.
DT_Translation_MercenaryCompanies/waywar: New to the region, hailing from far in the west: the region of Francia. Their customs and tongue are strange, and they rarely mix with the locals, spending what money they acquire in taverns and retreating to nurse their drinks in the deep woods.
DT_Translation_Military/backstabbing_des: When attacking the enemy, attack power is doubled if the enemy is facing backwards to the attacker, and enemies <h>BLOCK</> is no longer counted. This works both for melee and ranged attacks.
DT_Translation_Military/customize_retinu: Press to open the retinue customization panel
DT_Translation_Military/disband_descr: Militia and retainers will return to their daily lives as civilians.  Mercenaries will leave your service.
DT_Translation_Military/friendly_fire_de: Order unit to shoot even if there's a chance to hit their allies
DT_Translation_Military/friendly_fire_mo: Disciplined troops can shoot at the enemy even if friendly units are engaged.
DT_Translation_Military/mercenaries_desc: These soldies can be hired from the <h>MERCENARY POOL</> which is global and resets each month. A <h>MERCENARY COMPANY</> can come with one or multiple units. If one of the unit is disbanded, the whole company gets disbanded. Companies are paid upfront for each month of service.
DT_Translation_Military/militia_descr: Each male villager may be called to fight for their lord if the need arises. Militias can be formed into different <h>UNIT TYPES</>, each type has different strengths and weaknesses. A minimum of 5 equipped recruits are needed to <h>RALLY->RALLYING</> the unit. A villager is considered equipped when a weapon and shield (if applicable) is assigned to him. The helmet and body armor levels are optional and depend on each recruit's <h>RESIDENTIAL LEVEL</> and availability of goods in the region.
DT_Translation_Military/minimum_5_recrui: A minimum of 5 equipped recruits is required. Make sure you have enough Recruits and appropriate Weapons in the Region.
DT_Translation_Military/not_in_origin_re: Can't disband outside of the home Region
DT_Translation_Military/rally_descr: Pick a rallying spot and mobilize this unit for combat.
DT_Translation_Military/rallying_descr: When created, each unit is disbanded and villagers go about their daily business. After calling them to rally and picking a rallying point, they run to their homes to equip their war gear and rush to the rallying point. Only then the unit is ready for combat. After the battles are over, units can get disbanded again, villagers go back to work and retainers go back to the <h>MANOR</>.
DT_Translation_Military/release_at_will_: Instead of shooting a volley, soldiers fire aiming directly at the enemy. Increases accuracy up close, but decreases accuracy at half the maximum range or more.
DT_Translation_Military/remove_unit_desc: All the assigned recruits will return to the recruitment pool.
DT_Translation_Military/run_toggle_descr: Cover more ground at the cost of fatigue.
DT_Translation_Military/spread_out_descr: Makes soldiers harder to hit with missiles and makes the unit run slightly faster. Far less effective in melee.
DT_Translation_Military/stance_balanced_: Default stance with no bonus and no penalties
DT_Translation_Military/stance_giveGroun: Slowly pushes the formation line backward, luring the enemy to follow.
DT_Translation_Military/stance_missile_a: Soldiers watch for enemy missiles. Chance to avoid or block enemy missiles is doubled, but melee defense is halved.
DT_Translation_Military/stance_push_desc: Soldiers try to push forward with their full force.
DT_Translation_Military/stance_shieldwal: Soldiers form a tight defensive formation. The block value of immediately adjacent allies is added to each soldier's own block value. Slows the unit down significantly.
DT_Translation_Military/stance_standGrou: Soldiers try to stand their ground. Defense is doubled, but attack frequency is halved.
DT_Translation_Military/stop_descr: Stop movement and reform the formation.
DT_Translation_Military/total_advantage_: Effectiveness of the unit may depend on the situation and acts as a multiplier to the soldiers <h>ATTACK</>, <h>BLOCK</> and <h>DEFENSE</>. Effectiveness factors may include: <h>FATIGUE</>, <h>COHESION</>, <h>SURROUNDED</>, <h>SOAKING</>, <h>CLIMBING</>.
DT_Translation_Policies/policyID_2_descr: <h>WILD ANIMALS</> on <h>RICH DEPOSITS</> breed twice as fast, at the cost of 50% reduced yields from <h>CROPS</>.
DT_Translation_Policies/policyID_11_desc: Converts REGIONAL WEALTH to TREASURY at a rate of 1 silver per FAMILY, per month.
DT_Translation_Policies/policyID_12_desc: Citizens skip every 5th meal. Reduces <h>FOOD</> consumption, decreases <H>APPROVAL</>.
DT_Translation_Policies/policyID_14_desc: Every month, the region gives away 10% of the surplus FOOD to the church and converts it to INFLUENCE.
DT_Translation_Problems/problemID_0_desc: People require FOOD or they might starve.
DT_Translation_Problems/problemID_1_desc: People require FUEL and a BURGAGE PLOT to live in, or they might freeze to death.
DT_Translation_Problems/problemID_5_desc: You need to select the crop type for this field before it can be worked.
DT_Translation_Problems/problemID_9_desc: Bodies await burial. Ensure you have a church in the region and free up some families if necessary.
DT_Translation_Problems/problemID_13_des: Build more pastures or the livestock might run away.
DT_Translation_Problems/problemID_18_des: These people wait for more BURGAGE PLOTS. Causes a loss of APPROVAL, and possibility of FREEZING in the winters. {br}{br}Homeless cannot be a part of Militia units either.
DT_Translation_Problems/problemID_22_des: This settlement either needs more FOOD, or more FUEL. Check the SUPPLIES tooltip for more details.
DT_Translation_Problems/problemID_24_des: People request a well. If not provided, it will cause a loss of APPROVAL.
DT_Translation_Problems/problemID_25_des: You need a <h>FARMHOUSE</> to employ workers on the fields.
DT_Translation_Problems/problemID_26_des: Plot more <h>FIELDS</> so that the Farmhouse workers know where to work the land.
DT_Translation_Problems/problemID_28_des: Workers can't find anything to gather within their work area, at least for now.
DT_Translation_Problems/problemID_30: Disconnected from the major trade routes
DT_Translation_Problems/problemID_30_des: Connect the building to the king's road. Otherwise, it won't attract any <h>TRAVELLING MERCHANTS</>.
DT_Translation_Problems/problemID_31_des: Excess goods need to be moved to a storehouse. Otherwise, workers may stop production, and the overflowing storage is vulnerable to the weather damage.
DT_Translation_Problems/problemID_32_des: Excess food needs to be moved to a granary. Otherwise, workers may stop production, and the overflowing storage is vulnerable to the weather damage.
DT_Translation_Problems/problemID_33_des: Goods stored here are vulnerable to weather damage and need to be moved to a <h>STOREHOUSE</>.
DT_Translation_Problems/problemID_34_des: Goods stored here are vulnerable to weather damage and need to be moved to a <h>GRANARY</>.
DT_Translation_Problems/problemID_37_des: Build more <h>HITCHING POSTS</>, or upgrade one to a <h>STABLE</>. Otherwise, some livestock may run away.
DT_Translation_Problems/problemID_38_des: Families may start leaving the town.
DT_Translation_Problems/problemID_39_des: This burgage plot causes a loss of APPROVAL. Check the building panel for details.
DT_Translation_Problems/problemID_40: Unassigned families are needed for construction work.
DT_Translation_Problems/problemID_40_des: Unassign at least one <h>FAMILY</> from their workplace so that they can take over the construction.
DT_Translation_Problems/problemID_41_des: Unassigned oxen are needed for construction work
DT_Translation_Problems/problemID_42_des: Try hiring more warehouse or granary workers to improve your marketplace logistics.
DT_Translation_Problems/problemID_47_des: Villagers require to be buried on <h>HALLOWED GROUND</> of the <h>CHURCH</>, while raiders may be dumped into the <h>CORPSE PIT</>. Make sure you have a family assigned to handle it.
DT_Translation_QuestRelated/objective_co: Hold claim to all of the regions
DT_Translation_Quirks/bandit: Was a bandit once and robbed travellers
DT_Translation_Quirks/berserker: Goes into a frenzy when he fights
DT_Translation_Quirks/bookmaker: Takes bets on the outcome of battles
DT_Translation_Quirks/devout: A devout follower of a particular saint
DT_Translation_Quirks/drunkard: Always carries a flask of wine or ale with him
DT_Translation_Quirks/engineer: Worked as an engineer on siege equipment construction
DT_Translation_Quirks/falcon: Has a pet falcon that he uses for hunting and scouting
DT_Translation_Quirks/foreigner: A foreigner from a distant land
DT_Translation_Quirks/glutton: Eats more than anyone else, often leaving nothing for his comrades
DT_Translation_Quirks/healer: Knows how to treat wounds and diseases with herbs
DT_Translation_Quirks/hunter: Excells at hunting and tracking animals
DT_Translation_Quirks/in_love: Secretly in love with his lordâ€™s daughter
DT_Translation_Quirks/keen_eye: Has great eyesight and can hit even a small target from a long distance
DT_Translation_Quirks/mercenary: A former mercenary, often changing sides
DT_Translation_Quirks/miracle: Claims he performed a miracle once
DT_Translation_Quirks/monk: Left the monastery in pursuit of adventure
DT_Translation_Quirks/musician: A skilled musician and often entertains his comrades with his lute or flute
DT_Translation_Quirks/mute: Is a mute and communicates with gestures
DT_Translation_Quirks/philosopher: Loves getting into arguments with priests
DT_Translation_Quirks/poet: Often recites his verses before or after a fight
DT_Translation_Quirks/prankster: Enjoys playing jokes on his fellow warriors
DT_Translation_Quirks/prosthetic: Has a prosthetic eye from a previous battle
DT_Translation_Quirks/relic: Wears a relic around his neck
DT_Translation_Quirks/scarred: Has a scar on his bottom that he claims was inflicted by a dragon
DT_Translation_Quirks/sinner: Tormented by sins of the past
DT_Translation_Quirks/storyteller: Knows many legends and myths from different cultures and regions
DT_Translation_Quirks/thief: Steals anything that catches his eye
DT_Translation_Quirks/thinker: A fan of riddles and puzzles
DT_Translation_Quirks/wanderer: Never stays in one place for long
DT_Translation_Tasks/waiting_noDeerInRan: No game in range or hunting limit reached
DT_Translation_Tutorials/tutorial_animal: <t>ANIMAL SHELTER</>{br}{br} Your <h>LIVESTOCK</> needs accomodation or might run away. Ensure you have enough <h>STABLE SPACE</> (Ox, Horse, Mule) and <h>PASTURE SPACE</> (Sheep, Lamb).
ECOSYSTEM When your workers enter the forest, they might scare the WILD ANIMALS away and destroy BERRY DEPOSITS. Consider it when placing the logging camps.
DT_Translation_Tutorials/tutorial_beginn: In Manor Lords, families need FOOD and FUEL and roof above their heads to survive. {br}{br} SUPPLIES in the region panel above shows how much you've got left.
DT_Translation_Tutorials/tutorial_castle: <t>Welcome to the castle planner.</> {br}{br}This is a work in progress feature.{br}{br}Here you can edit the layout of your castle and plan the construction of new wings and towers.{br}{br}When you press commit, the old layout will disappear and the new one will be constructed. For now, the cost is also fixed.
DT_Translation_Tutorials/tutorial_constr: UNASSIGNED FAMILIES work on construction automatically.
DT_Translation_Tutorials/tutorial_develo: <t>SPECIALIZE YOUR REGION </>{br}{br}After you reach the next <h>SETTLEMENT LEVEL</>, you will be granted a <h>DEVELOPMENT POINT</> to spend. Unlock <h>DEVELOPMENT BRANCHES</> to make your region more efficient.{br}{br}To enact <h>POLICIES</>, you need to rise your <h>ADMINISTRATION LEVEL</> by building administrative buildings, like the <h>MANOR</>.
DT_Translation_Tutorials/tutorial_diseas: DISEASE {br}People suffering from disease may stop working. Access to HERBS might speed up their recovery, while a varied diet increases disease resistance.
DT_Translation_Tutorials/tutorial_earlyF: LOW ON FOOD?{br}{br}Try building a HUNTING CAMP if you have WILD ANIMALS in the Region, or a FORAGER HUT if you have a BERRY DEPOSIT.
DT_Translation_Tutorials/tutorial_farm_c: <t>FARMING CYCLES</>{br}{br}If the <h>FIELD</> is not set to <h>FALLOW</>, workers will plow it and sow the crop as soon as possible. <h>YIELD</> will increase as it grows and is harvested in September during the <h>HARVEST SEASON</>.
DT_Translation_Tutorials/tutorial_fatigu: RUNNING LONG DISTANCES Your men will get tired and might be unable to fight effectively. Consider marching instead for long travels. Use the Run to positions button to cycle between marching and running.
DT_Translation_Tutorials/tutorial_fieldP: Some buildings have flexible borders. Place 4 points to designate an area.{br}{br}1. The cursor will snap to roads and buildings to try and create an organic shape.{br}2. You can leave more space for future EXTENSION UPGRADES. {br}3. The first 2 points mark the front of the house by default.
DT_Translation_Tutorials/tutorial_fields: <t>PLOTTING THE FIELDS</> {br}{br} Fields in Manor Lords need to be very large to be effective, but also take long to plow by hand. For a starting village, try a field size of about 1 Morgen. {br}{br} Later, if you want the region to focus on farming, you can consider spending a <h>DEVELOPMENT POINT</> to unlock <h>HEAVY PLOW</> upgrade, which allows plowing  much bigger fields far more efficiently utilizing <h>OXEN</>. {br}{br}Also remember to check the ground <h>FERTILITY</> - some <h>CROP TYPES</> are more picky about the soil their grow on!
DT_Translation_Tutorials/tutorial_friend: Ranged units might stop shooting if there is a risk that they might hit their friends. This risk lowers if the shooter is very close to the enemy and has unobstructed line of sight.
DT_Translation_Tutorials/tutorial_fuel: <t>FUEL RESERVES</> {br}{br} Lack of fuel doesn't have immediate consequences until the Winter hits, then it might cause people to freeze. It's wise to store reserves for the winter.
DT_Translation_Tutorials/tutorial_gameSp: In almost all cases, resources in Manor Lords have to be physically moved. It can take a moment, so feel free to <h>CHANGE THE GAME SPEED</> if you feel like it. {br}{br}Game speed controls are in the bottom right.
DT_Translation_Tutorials/tutorial_Growth: To get more population you need to have enough empty BURGAGE PLOTS and your APPROVAL needs to be over 50%.
DT_Translation_Tutorials/tutorial_livest: While human workforce has to be assigned, by default <h>LIVESTOCK WORKFORCE IS SHARED BETWEEN WORKPLACES</>. {br}{br} However, you can bind it to a workplace permanently in the "advanced" tab. Just watch out so that you have unassigned oxen if you have any construction going on.
DT_Translation_Tutorials/tutorial_no_lab: <h>THIS BUILDING HAS NO ASSIGNED FAMILIES.</>{br}Select it and assign a family whenever you'd like to start production.
DT_Translation_Tutorials/tutorial_ox_tra: TIMBER TRANSPORTATION{br} TIMBER requires OXEN to be moved. Villagers will automatically get the ox when they need it.
DT_Translation_Tutorials/tutorial_pops: BURGAGE PLOTS{br}Homeless will move to the plot, and if APPROVAL is high enough, it might attract new families too. However, families need more than just space to be happy. Click on the building to check on their RESIDENTIAL REQUIREMENTS.
DT_Translation_Tutorials/tutorial_produc: <t>PRODUCTION FOCUS</> {br} <h>ARTISAN WORKSHOPS</> can sometimes produce multiple types of goods. To select what good is being produced, check the <h>GENERAL</> tab in the <h>BUILDING PANEL</>.
DT_Translation_Tutorials/tutorial_region: <t>MULTIPLE REGION MANAGEMENT</> {br}{br} You can quickly cycle between your commanded Regions by pressing "T".

<h>EVERY REGION IN MANOR LORDS HAS STRENGTHS AND WEAKNESSES. </> {br}{br}Be sure to check all the <h>RESOURCE DEPOSITS</> as well as investigate the <h>SOIL FERTILITY</> before deciding on the direction of your town. If your Region has weak <h>FERTILITY</>, consider setting up <h>TRADE</> early.
This view shows you which Regions are under whose control {br}You can press claims to other Regions when you gain enough INFLUENCE .
DT_Translation_Tutorials/tutorial_roads_: Some workplaces allow villagers to use <h>HANDCARTS</> to transport up to 10 goods at once. {br}{br}However, pulling a handcart off-road is extremely slow, so make sure to connect your buildings to <h>ROADS</>.
DT_Translation_Tutorials/tutorial_season: <t>SEASONAL RESOURCES</>{br}Some resources disappear when it's getting cold and reappear again in the spring.
DT_Translation_Tutorials/tutorial_sustai: SUSTAINABILITY Berries and hunting are good for a starting village, but eventually you'll need a more stable source of FOOD. Consider FARMING or setting up a TRADE ROUTE.
DT_Translation_Tutorials/tutorial_taxati: TAXATION{br}{br}Click on the "Taxes" tab after selecting your Manor to set levels of taxation. Taxes can boost your TREASURY and INFLUENCE at the cost of making your population poorer.
DT_Translation_Tutorials/tutorial_timber: <t>CAREFUL! YOU'RE ABOUT TO RUN OUT OF TIMBER AND BLOCK YOURSELF! </>{br}Make sure you have a <h>LOGGING CAMP</> before placing more buildings.
DT_Translation_Tutorials/tutorials_armyM: Select units with the LEFT MOUSE BUTTON. Hold and drag to select multiple units. {br}{br} Command selected units with the RIGHT MOUSE BUTTON. {br}{br}Hold and drag to form a line. Hold ALT while dragging to keep the formation when multiple units are commanded. Hold CTRL and to draw waypoints for a single squad.
DT_Translation_Tutorials/tutorials_farmi: <h>FARMHOUSE</> employs families who work on the <h>FIELDS</>. The workforce is distributed proportionally in accordance with the field's set <h>PRIORITY</> level. {br}{br}When crops are growing, they absorb certain nutrients from the soil,  temporarily lowering its <h>FERTILITY</> and thus diminishing yields over time. To combat this, consider changing crop types or, even better, leaving the field fallow for a year.
DT_Translation_Tutorials/tutorials_marke: A well-supplied marketplace is the lifeblood of your town. {br}{br}1. Assigned families will <h>SET UP STALLS AUTOMATICALLY</>, as long as there is enough space on the market.{br}2. Hover over specific categories to check your current <H>SUPPLY AND DEMAND</>.{br}3. Burgage plots  <h>CLOSEST TO THE MARKET</> get their market requirements fulfilled first!
DT_Translation_Tutorials/tutorials_milit: You created your first militia unit

The male villagers will be evenly distributed between all militia units. {br}{br}They will then try to find the <h>REQUIRED EQUIPMENT</> - the weapon and shield depends on the unit type, while the maximum quality of body armor and helmet depends on the villager's <h>RESIDENTIAL LEVEL</>. {br}{br}After bringing all the necessary equipment home, the unit recruits are marked as ready to rally. {br}{br}Only then you will be able to <h>RALLY YOUR UNIT</>!
DT_Translation_Tutorials/tutorials_squad: The combat strength of your units depends on many factors: {br}{br}STANCES. Check the army tab below to set them, all have pros and cons. {br}{br} MORALE is the willingness to fight. If it reaches critical points, some stances become unavailable, and eventually the unit will flee from battle.{br}{br} FATIGUE. Soldiers become tired when running and fighting, when exhausted, they can no longer run or fight well. {br}{br}EFFECTIVENESS is the attack and defense multiplier. The unit might have a hard time fighting uphill, or archers struggle while shooting in the rain. Hold TAB to inspect the details.
DT_Translation_Upgrades/upgradeID_2_desc: Level 2 BURGAGE PLOTS generate 1 REGIONAL WEALTH per FAMILY, per month. {br}{br} Unlocks new EXTENSIONS, including ARTISAN WORKSHOPS. RESIDENTIAL REQUIREMENTS will increase!
DT_Translation_Upgrades/upgradeID_4_desc: Level 3 BURGAGE PLOTS generate 2 REGIONAL WEALTH per family, per month. {br}Required to rise the SETTLEMENT LEVEL. Adds living space for 1 extra FAMILY (and 2 families for plots with living space expansion). RESIDENTIAL REQUIREMENTS will increase!
DT_Translation_Upgrades/upgradeID_6: Upgrade to a small stone church
DT_Translation_Upgrades/upgradeID_10_des: Enables employing <h>HORSES</> at the <h>TRADING POST</> for significantly faster trade.
DT_Translation_Upgrades/upgradeID_11_des: Enables employing <h>OXEN</> at the <h>FARMHOUSE</> for significantly faster plowing of large fields, as well as bringing crops back to storage more efficiently.
DT_Translation_Upgrades/upgradeID_12_des: Doubles the maximum family count for this burgage plot.
DT_Translation_Upgrades/upgradeID_13_des: After placing an order, a livestock merchant will come to your town and deliver the animal. Orders can be placed once a month.
DT_Translation_Upgrades/upgradeID_15_des: Allows FORAGER HUT workers to grow HERBS.
DT_Translation_Upgrades/upgradeID_17_des: Allows to use a <h>FALLOW</> field as a <h>PASTURE</>, which rapidly restores lost <h>FERTILITY</>.
DT_Translation_Upgrades/upgradeID_18_des: Enables the building to extract resources indefinitely if placed over a <h>RICH DEPOSIT</>.
DT_Translation_Upgrades/upgradeID_19_des: After placing an order, a livestock merchant will come to your town and deliver the animal. Orders can be placed once a month.
DT_Translation_Upgrades/upgradeID_20_des: Provides crude living space for 5 families. Contrary to Burgage Plots, can't be upgraded or expanded and may cause a small loss of <h>APPROVAL</>. {br}{br} Best suited as worker accomodation for <h>OUTPOSTS</>.
DT_Translation_Upgrades/upgradeID_21_des: After placing an order, a livestock merchant will come to your town and deliver the animal. Orders can be placed once a month per Region. For more frequent trading build a  <h>LIVESTOCK TRADER</>.
DT_Translation_Upgrades/upgradeID_101_de: Provides a passive yield of EGGS.
DT_Translation_Upgrades/upgradeID_102_de: Provides a passive yield of HIDES.
DT_Translation_Upgrades/upgradeID_103_de: Enables production of TOOLS, SPEARS and SIDEARMS. {br}{br}Converts all inhabitants to ARTISANS, locking them from being assigned to other jobs.
DT_Translation_Upgrades/upgradeID_104_de: Produces BREAD from FLOUR with twice the efficiency of the communal oven. {br}{br}Converts all inhabitants to ARTISANS, locking them from being assigned to other jobs.
DT_Translation_Upgrades/upgradeID_105_de: Produces ALE from MALT. {br}{br}Converts all inhabitants to ARTISANS, locking them from being assigned to other jobs.
DT_Translation_Upgrades/upgradeID_106_de: Enables production of CLOTHES and CLOAKS and GAMBESONS. {br}{br}Converts all inhabitants to ARTISANS, locking them from being assigned to other jobs.
DT_Translation_Upgrades/upgradeID_107_de: Enables production of SHOES. {br}{br}Converts all inhabitants to ARTISANS, locking them from being assigned to other jobs.
DT_Translation_Upgrades/upgradeID_108_de: Allows growing VEGETABLES. Requires plowing and harvesting labor. Yields depend on the plot size.
DT_Translation_Upgrades/upgradeID_109_de: Enables production of WOODEN PARTS and SHIELDS. {br}{br}Converts all inhabitants to ARTISANS, locking them from being assigned to other jobs.
DT_Translation_Upgrades/upgradeID_110_de: Enables production of HELMETS.{br}{br}After unlocking ADVANCED ARMORMAKING and MASTER ARMORMAKING enables production of MAIL ARMOR and PLATE ARMOR.{br}{br}Converts all inhabitants to ARTISANS, locking them from being assigned to other jobs.
DT_Translation_Upgrades/upgradeID_111_de: Enables production of WARBOWS. {br}{br}Converts all inhabitants to ARTISANS, locking them from being assigned to other jobs.
DT_Translation_Upgrades/upgradeID_112_de: Produces APPLES. Apple harvest happens around September every year. {br}{br} Until the trees are fully grown, which takes around 3 years, the orchards produce only a fraction of the yield.
DT_Translation_Weather_and_Seasons/toolt: Seasons are deeply connected to people's lives and affect different jobs.
<h>WINTER</>  <i>(Dec-Feb)</> Seasonal resources are gone. Firewood consumption doubled and lack of firewood might cause freezing. Sheep shearing forbidden.
DT_Translation_Wiki/artisans_descr: Artisans are family members (<h>FAMILY</>) who have been permanently assigned to work at their home by building a <h>WORKSHOP</> in the <h>EXTENSION SLOT</>.
DT_Translation_Wiki/construction_descr: When the player places a new building, it has to be constructed. First, the required <h>CONSTRUCTION GOODS</> need to be physically brought to the construction site. This is done by <h>UNASSIGNED FAMILIES</>, often with the help of <h>OXEN</> hauling the <h>TIMBER</>. Then, <h>UNASSIGNED FAMILIES</> will perform construction tasks until the building is fully constructed. Only then it becomes actually functional.
DT_Translation_Wiki/development_point_de: Development points are gained by increasing the <h>SETTLEMENT LEVEL</>
DT_Translation_Wiki/essential_commoditie: Resources that are consumed 1 per <h>FAMILY</> per year. If they aren't supplied, it can cause negative effects. Lack of <h>TOOLS</> leads to 30% chance of failure during crafting. Effects for other goods are still work in progress.
DT_Translation_Wiki/extension_slot_descr: Space in the backyard of any large <h>BURGAGE PLOT</> which can be used to build an <h>EXTENSION</> or a <h>WORKSHOP</>.
DT_Translation_Wiki/family_descr: Families are the basic unit and the foundation of the whole game. Each family consists of multiple family members. Each family consumes 1 FOOD per month, and up to 2 FUEL per month (FUEL CONSUMPTION). Families live in RESIDENTIAL BUILDINGS, and the FAMILY LEVEL is equal to the level of their housing. {br}{br} Each family can be assigned to a specific WORKPLACE, unless it has been converted to ARTISANS, then it permanently works at their home. Male family members (husbands and sons) can become members of the MILITIA.
DT_Translation_Wiki/free_merchants_descr: Free merchants travel between <h>TRADEPOINTS</>, visiting the player's <h>TRADING POST</> buildings if they are on the way. When visiting the Trading Post, they commence <h>TRADE</> with the <h>REGION</>.
DT_Translation_Wiki/population_growth_de: New <h>FAMILIES</> may join the settlement only if there is enough <h>LIVING SPACE</> and <h>APPROVAL</> is high enough. If <h>APPROVAL</> is 75% or higher the growth rate is 2 families per month. 50% or higher is 1 family per month. If <h>APPROVAL</> drops below 25%, it will cause <h>EMIGRATION</>. Families may also turn to <h>BANDITRY</> if <h>PUBLIC ORDER</> is low.
DT_Translation_Wiki/region_descr: The game map is divided into multiple Regions. Each region is a separate economic entity that has it's own <h>REGIONAL WEALTH</>, <h>STOCK</>, buildings, taxes and families (<h>FAMILY</>). Regions can only exchange goods by <h>TRADE</>. Each Region may be owned by a single <h>RULER</>.
DT_Translation_Wiki/reserved_resources_d: <h>STOCK</> which is dedicated for <h>CRAFTING</> or <h>CONSTRUCTION</> and therefore no longer accounts as <h>SURPLUS</>.
DT_Translation_Wiki/retinue_descr: Professional soldiers in service of the <h>RULER</> and bound to the region's <h>MANOR</>. Usually lower nobles, Lord's family members or other member of the court. As long as the Manor has enough space (check <h>MANOR MODULES</>), you can hire new retainers using either <h>TREASURY</>, or buy required equipment from your settlement at a large discount.
DT_Translation_Wiki/settlement_level_des: Every <h>REGION</> has a settlement level. To reach the next level, players must fulfill all requirements. When the next level is reached, <h>REGION</> gets a new <h>DEVELOPMENT POINT</> and unlocks new buildings and upgrades. To see what is required for the next settlement level, hover the settlement name in the <h>REGION PANEL</> on the top of the screen.
DT_Translation_Wiki/stock_descr: Number of goods physically stored in one of the buildings and taking up <h>STORAGE</>.
DT_Translation_Wiki/storage_buildings_de: These buildings are used primarily to store and distribute <h>SURPLUS</> resources : <h>STOREHOUSE</>, <h>LARGE STOREHOUSE</>, <h>SMALL GRANARY</>, <h>LARGE GRANARY</>. Storehouses use <h>GENERIC STORAGE</>, while granaries have <h>PANTRY</> space for <h>FOOD</>.
DT_Translation_Wiki/storage_descr: There are 3 types of storage in the game currently: <h>GENERIC STORAGE</>, <h>PANTRY</>, and <h>LOG STORAGE</>. Different buildings have different <h>STORAGE LIMITS</> for each category. Each resource belongs to a specific storage category, for example <h>FIREWOOD</> belongs to <h>GENERIC STORAGE</> while <h>BREAD</> belongs in a <h>PANTRY</>. When storage reaches its limits in <h>PRODUCTION BUILDINGS</>, labor stops. When storage exceeds limits, <h>WEATHER DAMAGE</> might destroy resources. To avoid reaching or exceeding <h>STORAGE LIMITS</>, make sure you have enough <h>STORAGE BUILDINGS</> with enough <h>ASSIGNED FAMILIES</>.
DT_Translation_Wiki/surplus_descr: Surplus equals <h>STOCK</> minus <h>RESERVED</>. For example if you store 5 <h>PLANKS</>, but place a building that costs 3 <h>PLANKS</>, you still have 5 Stock, but only 2 Surplus.
DT_Translation_Wiki/tradepoints_descr: Points on the edge of the playable game area that may become a destination of TRADE. They represent trade that flows to and from lands far away, and imports going through them cost extra 10 REGIONAL WEALTH.
DT_Translation_Wiki/travelling_merchants: Free merchants travel between <h>TRADEPOINTS</>, visiting the player's <h>TRADING POST</> buildings if they are on the way. When visiting the Trading Post, they commence <h>TRADE</> with the <h>REGION</>.
DT_Translation_Wiki/weather_damage_descr: Rain and snowfall may irreversibly destroy resources that are exposed. To avoid exposure, resources need to be placed in appropriate <h>STORAGE</> with respects to the building's <h>STORAGE LIMITS</>. {br}{br}On easy and normal <h>DIFFICULTY SETTINGS</>, the destruction happens only every second weather event and the player gets a warning.
